# Harmonic Scale in F# (Mode: Ionian augmented, Shape: E)

## Overview
The Harmonic Scale is a seven-note scale with a unique interval pattern that results in a distinct sound. When played in F#, the scale functions in the Ionian augmented mode with the E shape.

## Notes and Intervals
- F# (Root)
- G# (Major 2nd)
- A# (Major 3rd)
- B (Perfect 4th)
- C## (Augmented 5th)
- E (Major 7th)
- F# (Octave)

## Musical Flavor and Usage
The Harmonic Scale in F# with the Ionian augmented mode and E shape has a tense and dissonant quality due to the augmented 5th interval (C##). This scale is commonly used in jazz and fusion music to create a sense of tension and add a modern, avant-garde flavor to compositions.
